heroSection.title: From One Licensee to Another
heroSection.subtitle: We run The Anchor in Stanwell Moor. We unlocked 25 hours of value per week by applying AI across our pub. Now we share what we've learned with other pub licensees.

story: I'm Peter. Billy runs The Anchor in Stanwell Moor day-to-day, and I handle marketing and business development around a full-time role. Like you, we've faced empty tables, rising costs, and 70-hour weeks wondering if it's all worth it.

Everything changed when I discovered how AI could transform pub operations. As an early adopter since 2021, I've tested everything - the failures taught me what to avoid, the successes showed me what to share.

Today, our quiz nights attract 25-30 regular teams every month, we've cut ¬£250/week in Sunday waste and ¬£4,000+ a month in supplier, rota, and energy costs, and we actually have evenings off. Orange Jelly exists so other pub licensees can achieve the same transformation without the guesswork.

founderSection.name: Meet Peter Pitcher
bio: I'm not your typical consultant. By day, I'm an AI Marketing Capabilities Lead for a global food manufacturer. Billy runs The Anchor day-to-day, and I jump in on nights and weekends while handling marketing and business development in my spare time.
My curiosity for technology made me an early AI adopter in 2021. When I saw how it could save hours on pub admin, I had to share it with other pub licensees struggling like we were.
Now I help pub licensees implement the same AI workflows that transformed our business. No theory, no fluff - just practical tools that work in real pub life.
founderSection.quote: Every strategy we recommend has been tested in our own pub first. If it doesn't work for us, we won't recommend it to you.

faqs.question: Who is Peter Pitcher and why should I trust Orange Jelly?
faqs.answer: I'm Peter Pitcher. Billy runs The Anchor pub in Stanwell Moor day-to-day, and I handle marketing and business development around my full-time role as an AI Marketing Capabilities Lead for a global food manufacturer. I've been an early AI adopter since 2021 and discovered how AI can add 25 hours of value per week. Orange Jelly exists to share these proven strategies with pubs, restaurants, and bars.

faqs.question: What makes Orange Jelly different from other consultants?
faqs.answer: We're not consultants who've never pulled a pint. We run an actual pub and test every strategy in our own business first. No corporate nonsense, no jargon - just one licensee helping another with tools that actually work.

faqs.question: Is Orange Jelly a big company?
faqs.answer: No, Orange Jelly started in 2016 with Laura Willis as a digital agency, then pivoted in 2019. Now it's just me (Peter) working around my full-time job, while Billy runs The Anchor day-to-day. No big office, no sales team. This means you get personal service, honest advice, and someone who genuinely understands your challenges because I face them too.

faqs.question: Why is it called Orange Jelly?
faqs.answer: Just a fun play on words in a world that's ever-changing! We wanted a name that's friendly, memorable, and doesn't take itself too seriously - just like us. It reflects our approach: making complicated things simple and approachable.

faqs.question: Can I visit The Anchor to see your strategies in action?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! We'd love to show you around. Pop in for a pint and see how we use AI tools in real pub operations. First pint's on me if you mention Orange Jelly. We're at Horton Road, Stanwell Moor, Staines TW19 6AQ.

faqs.question: How did you discover AI could help pubs?
faqs.answer: Through my curiosity for technology and being an early adopter. I started with ChatGPT in 2021 when it first launched. The early results were terrible, but as the models evolved, they became business-ready. Now AI helps us unlock 25 hours of value per week in the pub.

faqs.question: What results have you achieved at The Anchor?
faqs.answer: We reach 60,000-70,000 people every month on social media, our quiz nights now attract 25-30 regular teams each month, we've cut ¬£250/week in Sunday waste and ¬£4,000+ a month in supplier, rota, and energy costs, and added ¬£75,000-¬£100,000 of value to our business using AI. Most importantly - we got our evenings back. Every strategy we share has delivered real results in our own pub.

faqs.question: Do you understand the challenges of running a small pub?
faqs.answer: Completely. We've dealt with empty Monday nights, staff no-shows, supplier price hikes, TripAdvisor nightmares, and competing with Wetherspoons. That's why our solutions are practical, affordable, and designed for real pub life.

faqs.question: Is Orange Jelly just about AI and technology?
faqs.answer: No, it's about giving you your life back. AI is just the tool - the real goal is helping you work less and earn more. Whether that's automating social media so you can have Sunday lunch with family, or creating menus that sell themselves so you're not stressing about GP.

faqs.question: How can I be sure Orange Jelly will work for my pub?
faqs.answer: Every pub is different, but the challenges are similar. That's why we offer a free consultation to understand your specific situation and stay hands-on through the first month so adjustments happen quickly. These aren't theories - they're proven strategies from our own pub.

faqs.question: What areas does Orange Jelly cover?
faqs.answer: For in-person training and consultations, we cover a 30-mile radius from Stanwell Moor (Surrey, Berkshire, West London). For online services like marketing and menu design, we help pubs across the UK. Technology means distance isn't a barrier.

faqs.question: What's your promise to pub owners?
faqs.answer: To help you claw back up to 25 hours every week on admin tasks, be honest about what AI can and can't do, only recommend tools we use ourselves, keep prices transparent and fair, and provide personal support when you need it.
